body.p: The Amazon S3 connector facilitates the publishing of deliverable build outputs to the designated Bucket.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: To publish content to an Amazon S3 Bucket, ensure you have the following:

ul.li: An existing S3 Bucket configured. For more details, refer to the AWS S3 Documentation
The Access Key ID and Secret Access Key associated with your AWS account. For more details, refer to the AWS Security Credentials Documentation

section.p: For additional information regarding the above points, please consult the AWS Documentation.

section.title: Define the Connector
section.p:
To configure an Amazon S3 Connector, the following fields must be provided:
Connector Name The name of the connector.
Region Name The AWS Region where your Amazon S3 bucket is hosted. When you create a bucket, you specify the AWS Region where you want Amazon S3 to create the bucket.
Bucket Name The Amazon S3 container used for storing your files.
Access Key ID A unique identifier associated with your AWS account or with an IAM user.
Secret Access Key The secret key used together with Access key ID for authentication.

section.title: Select the Amazon S3 Connector in Deliverable Settings Page
section.p:
To publish the output of a deliverable to Amazon S3, please proceed with the following steps:
After configuring the Amazon S3 Connector, navigate to the Deliverable Settings page. You can access this page by either editing an existing Deliverable or creating a new one.
Within the Deliverable Settings page, check the "Upload output using a publishing connector" option checkbox.
Select the Amazon S3 Connector that you previously defined from the provided list.
Specify the Destination Folder where the build output will be published. Ensure that the designated folder already exists within the Amazon S3 Bucket.The output will be published as a zip archive in this folder.
Save the Deliverable settings.
Begin the Deliverable build process. Upon completion, the build output will be published to the configured Amazon S3 Bucket as a zip archive within the folder you previously designated as the destination folder.

section.title: (Optional) Lambda Function to unzip content
section.p: The Amazon S3 Connector will publish the deliverable output as a zip file to the Destination Folder specified in the Deliverable Settings page. To extract the file, one approach is to configure a Lambda Function on AWS to unzip the archive within your designated Documentation Folder. (add the link to the procedure on how to define a lambda function)The Documentation Folder should be the folder that is publicly accessible to users.

section.title: (Optional) Lifecycle Rule to delete incomplete uploads
section.p: The Amazon S3 Connector will use multipart upload for larger files in order to optimize performance. If the upload is interrupted before completing, upload parts may remain stored inside your Amazon S3 Bucket. It is recommended to configure a Lifecycle Rule (add the link to the procedure on how to configure a lifecycle rule) for your bucket to automatically delete incomplete multipart uploads.
